North_Las_Vegas.Cashman Field: Cashman Field is a mixed-use stadium in Las Vegas, Nevada owned and operated by the Las Vegas Convention and Visitors Authority. Its primary use is for baseball and soccer as the home field of the Las Vegas 51s (Triple-A affiliate of the New York Mets) and the Las Vegas Lights FC. The field is adjacent to Cashman Center, an exhibit hall and theater, operated by the City of Las Vegas,. The complex was named for James "Big Jim" Cashman and his family, who have been Las Vegas entrepreneurs for several generations.
